description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior Manager, Strategy and Operations to join our Omni team at Sam's Club. You will help shape and execute the business strategy.

You will work with teams to identify growth opportunities, inspire innovation, and improve the Member experience across Omni channel business.

You will report to the Director, Business Strategy . This position is based out of Bentonville, Arkansas and working a hybrid schedule (mix of remote and in office).

About Omni Strategy & Operations Team :

The Omni Strategy and Business Operations team works cross-functionally to develop the future vision of Omni at Sam's Club, accelerates financial and operational performance by leading regular business reviews and leads strategic initiatives to drive growth and improve Member experience.

What you'll do :
• Develop and execute the Omni strategy for Sam's Club, aligning with the business objectives while driving performance against our annual operating plan.
• Build, monitor and analyze performance to measure the success of the Omni business while playing a key role in identifying and implementing opportunities to drive sales, profitability or Member experience.
• Collaborate with partners, including senior leadership, to Identify growth opportunities in the Omni space.
• Lead strategy and preparation for how Omni is represented across the enterprise including monthly strategy reviews, P&L reviews, trading meetings.
• Conduct market research industry trends, and gather competitive intelligence to inform strategic decision-making.
• Lead the development of business cases and financial models to evaluate potential initiatives and investments.
• Partner with cross-functional teams, including Marketing, Operations, Merchandising, and product, to lead complex initiatives from concept to execution.
• Develop and deliver presentations to senior leadership and other team members to communicate strategy and results.

What you'll bring :
• A strong analytical background
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills and are capable of creating presentations suitable for executives.
• You have experience leading multiple projects and supporting various business initiatives.
• You have strong problem solving and technical skills enabling effective solutions leading to high customer satisfaction .
• You know financial planning inside and out.

The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.

Benefits & Perks :

Equal Opportunity Employer :

Sam's Club is an Equal Opportunity Employer- By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them.

That means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, abilities, ideas and opinions- while being inclusive of all people.

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Social Science, Communications, or related field and 4 years' experience in retail merchandising, operations management, or related area OR 6 years' experience in retail merchandising, operations management, or related area.

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Leading cross-functional teams, Supervisory experience

Primary Location...
